channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024110212
item.description:
Report E-2024110212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 5, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the paint-impacted trailer. All spent absorbent pads, impacted wrap, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was collected and containerized into one (1) overpack drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110126
item.description:
Report E-2024110126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-09T00:55:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint releasee from four (4) one (1) pint cans of SikaBiresin® CH910-2 Blade Repair Part B, impacting the trailer floor. The release was due to the product being crushed by other freight. Dayton Freight personnel advised they cleaned and neutralized impacted area. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110109
item.description:
Report E-2024110109

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 29, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE deployed granular absorbents on the impacted dock floor and began utilizing hand tools to collect spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew damaged pail into tone (1) 30-gallon drum. HCE staged the waste on site for further management.

item.title: Report E-2024110110
item.description:
Report E-2024110110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 28, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE deployed granular absorbents on the impacted trailer floor aand began utilizing hand tools to collect spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew placed the empty, damaged pail into the previously mentioned drum. HCE staged the waste on site for further management.

item.title: Report E-2024110112
item.description:
Report E-2024110112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 29, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3267 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the site. ES+ personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3267-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. E3 personnel transferred the product from the 275-gallon tote to a 330-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for future disposal by CES personnel.
